author.name: Bryan Berry - Nathen Harvey - Matt Ray

entry.title: Habitat
entry.content:
Watch Now

Join us for a discussion about Habitat a new approach to automation that focuses on the application instead of the infrastructure it runs on. With Habitat, the apps you build, deploy, and manage behave consistently in any runtime — metal, VMs, containers, and PaaS. You'll spend less time on the environment and more time building features.

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Download
    • Video
    • Audio

Panel

  • Adam Jacob twitter, github
  • Nell Shamrell-Harrington github, twitter, blog
  • Jamie Winsor github, twitter, blog
  • Brandon Burton github, twitter
  • Mike Fiedler github, twitter, blog
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline & Show Notes

Show Notes

  • Happy 100th Episode!
  • What is Habitat?
  • Does Habitat do too much?
  • The Build System
    • Why build a packaging system?
    • Supervisors ans Artifacts
  • Docker
  • How all-or-nothing is Habitat?
    • Progressive Reveal
  • Chef
    • Chef Delivery
  • Terraform
  • What's the plan with Windows?
  • Habitat Feedback
  • Getting Started
    • HabiChat

entry.title: InSpec
entry.content:
Watch Now

Join us for a discussion about InSpec, the open-source testing framework for infrastructure with a human- and machine-readable language for specifying compliance, security, and policy requirements.

Outline & Show Notes

What's Cooking? - Chef News & Events

  • Webinars:
    • Test Driven Cookbook Development - February 24

    • Chef Analytics 1.3.0 Release
    • Server Admins Grant More Flexible Permissions Around User Management
    • Chef Client 12.7 Released
    • Chef Compliance 0.11.1 release
      • Chef Compliance 0.14.5 is now available!
  • From the mailing list - https://discourse.chef.io/
    • New releases of delivery-truck and delivery-sugar
  • New on the supermarket
    • Recent Cookbooks
      • sssd_ad v0.6.0 - installs SSSD on a Ubuntu system and configures it for Active Directory authentication
      • flywaydb v3.0.0 - Installs flywaydb and allows for execution of flyway commands via resource actions.
      • chef_install_configure_collectd v0.1.3 - a set of recipes to install and configure collectd
      • gimp v1.0.1 - installs GIMP
      • netapp_e v1.1.0 - Manages NetApp E-Series storage systems
      • divvy v0.2.1
      • ceph-chef v0.9.8 - Installs/Configures Ceph (Hammer and above)
      • seven_zip v2.0.0 - Installs/Configures the 7-zip file archiver and provides the seven_zip_archive resource
      • sumologic-collector v1.2.4
      • dynatrace v0.1.13 - Installs the Dynatrace Application Monitoring solution.
      • Follow @getgetchef on twitter for more cookbook updates.
    • Recent Tools and Plugins
      • knife-acropolis
      • os-hardening
  • Upcoming Events
    • ChefConf 2016 - July 11-13 in Austin, Texas. CFP and ticket sales are now open.
    • Bucks County Tech Meetup
    • Successful Practices for Continuous Delivery – DevOpsDC Meetup
    • DevOpsDays

      • London - April 19-20
      • Rockies/Denver - April 21-22
      • Atlanta - April 26-27

      • Chicago - August 30-31

      • Detroit - October 11-12

Show Notes

  • InSpec - open-source testing framework for infrastructure with a human- and machine-readable language for specifying compliance, security and policy requirements.
  • Inspec vs Serverspec
  • Why another test framework?
  • Testing
  • Who are the target users of inspec?
  • Security
    • List of InSpec resources
    • When do I use inspec in my infrastructure's lifecycle?
      • Testkitchen
    • Out of compliance
  • Chef Compliance
  • The inspec command line interface
  • Train - Transport Interface to unify communication over SSH, WinRM, and friends.

  • New on the supermarket
    • Recent Cookbooks
      • nginx_server v1.0.1
      • docker v2.4.12
      • artifactory-artifact v0.2.0
      • prun-cfg v0.2.25 (PostgreSQL / Ruby on Rails/ Ubuntu / Nginx)
      • telegraf v0.3.3
      • os_floating_lo v0.1.2

      • jetty v0.4.1 - Deprecated
      • sqlite v1.1.3 - Deprecated
      • sensu-handlers v0.1.7
      • Follow @getgetchef on twitter for more cookbook updates.
    • Recent Tools and Plugins
      • Reagan - Ruby Jenkins build script that automates the testing of individual items in a monolithic chef-repo.
      • kitchen-chef-extended-attributes - Kitchen Driver that allows you to use test-kitchen with chef-solo - and automatically link suites to the same named JSON dna file to ensure your node specification doesn't drift from your test definition.
      • /tmp Compliance Profile - An example compliance profile built with InSpec
      • Rubymine Chef Configs - Rubymine configurations for Chef
  • Upcoming Events
    • ChefConf 2016 - July 11-13 in Austin, Texas. CFP and ticket sales are now open.

entry.title: Learning Reviews
entry.content:
Join us for a discussion of Learning Reviews. What and how can we learn from failure?

Watch Now

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Video
    • Audio

Panel

  • Dave Zwieback twitter, blog, github
  • Caitlin Milligan Sheaffer twitter
  • Lola Soto twitter
  • Christopher Webber github, twitter
  • Yulia Sheynkman about
  • Robb Kidd github, twitter
  • Mike Fiedler github, twitter, blog
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline & Show Notes

  • Beyond Blame: Learning From Failure and Success by Dave Zwieback
  • Learning Reviews vs Performance Reviews and Postmortems
  • Blameless Postmortems
  • The History of the Book and The Postmortems Workshops
  • Lola's Postmortem Workshop Experience
  • Identifying and Preventing Blame
  • Accountability
  • Prioritization
  • Tradeoffs
  • Understanding Risk
  • Discount Rank (Why is an executive in the room?)
  • Where do you start?
  • Closing Comments
    • Postmortems reveal a lot of opportunities for organizational change. There is ideally a channel for directing this to the right team. (And someone empowered/able to manage that process)
    • Maybe you'd have an executives-only learning review about, say, a recent board meeting
    • Assess the degree of organizational maturity when figuring out how to set up learning reviews for success.
  • Other Resources:
    • A Tough Day as Leaders
    • MINDWEATHER - Follow Dave and learn about upcoming workshops

Picks

Dave

  • Beyond Blame: Learning from Failure and Success

Nathen

  • Food Fight Show 14 - Live Post-Mortem With David Zwieback, John Allspaw, and Mike Rembetsy
  • Community Pulse podcast

Mike

  • Blue Apron
  • Wüsthof Knives

Robb

  • Dave's new book!
  • Incident Management for Operations by Rob Schnepp, Ron Vidal, and Chris Hawley (in early release at O'Reilly)
  • Not Your Father's Root Beer by Small Town Brewery

Christopher

  • Silos, Politics, and Turf Wars
  • Enjoy By IPA by Stone Brewing
  • Chef Delivery

Yulia

  • Bone broth
  • Elephant in the Room: How Relationships Make or Break the Success of Leaders and Organizations, Diana MacLane Smith
  • Thanks for the Feedback, Douglas Stone

Caitlin

  • Digital PM Summit from the Bureau of Digital
  • Hamilton, a musical, and the Broadway cast recording on Spotify

Lola

  • The Power of Now, Eckhart Tolle

  • Audio

  • Mike Fiedler github, twitter, blog
  • John Vincent, aka Lusis twitter, github
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter

Outline

  • How The Food Fight Show got started
  • Favorite Episodes:
    • Testing in Practice
    • Back to the Kernel With Greg Kroah-Hartman
    • TESTALLTHETHINGS: Testing Infrastructure with Jim Hopp, Stephen Nelson-Smith, and Andrew Crump
    • Live Post-Mortem With David Zwieback, John Allspaw, and Mike Rembetsy
    • Adrian Cockcroft Episode => Netflix OSS
    • Steven Murawski Episode => Windows Automation for Frustrated Sysadmins
    • Nordstrom Episode => Windows Roundtable
    • Live Episodes
    • LWRPs
    • Application Deployment
    • Continuous Delivery
  • What has gotten better in the DevOps community since the show started?
    • Diversity
    • The rise of "Small Town" DevOps Days
  • The DevOps Debate
    • "DevOps" across the industry
    • WHAT DOES "DEVOPS" MEAN?!?!?!
    • Improving knowledge
    • Continuous improvement: The new "CI"
    • Gene Kim (Twitter)
  • Grievances
    • Priveledge, Flexibility, & Time
    • The passing of James Golick, Ezra Zygmuntowicz, and Jim Weirich
    • Linux is becoming dominant
    • OpenStack
    • "Working Code Builds Consensus" -- Jesse Robins
    • Neglecting the humanity: We are PEOPLE too!
    • No managers?

Picks

Brandon

  • Jon Cowie: Remote Working: 3 Year Retrospective

Nathen

  • Start
    • scheduling more regular Food Fight Show episodes
    • Have a Book Club series: POODR: Practical Object-Oriented Design in Ruby: An Agile Primer by Sandi Metz.
  • Stop
    • having panels that are all white men.
  • Continue
    • Having discussions about technology.
    • doing Chef-specific episodes.

Matt

  • SoftwareDefinedTalk
  • The Everything Store: Jeff Bezos and the Age of Amazon
  • Your Local Library

John

  • Logitech Wireless Solar Keyboard K750

Mike

  • Ready Player One by Ernest Cline

Bryan

  • The Click Library from Python

  • Nathen Harvey
